content.description:
The Romans land in Britannia.

1 Atque nostris militibus cunctantibus, maxime

propter altitudinem maris, qui X legionis aquilam

gerebat, obtestatusobtestor, obtestari, obtestatus sum: implore deos, ut ea res legioni feliciter

eveniret, “desilite,” inquit, “milites, nisi vultis

5aquilam hostibus prodere; ego certe meum rei

publicae atque imperatori officium praestitero.”praesto, praestare, praestiti: discharge, fulfill

Hoc cum voce magna dixisset, se ex navi proiecit

atque in hostes aquilam ferre coepit. Tum nostri

cohortati inter se, ne tantum dedecusdedecus, dedecoris, n.: disgrace admitteretur,

10 universi ex navi desiluerunt.
content.question: A typical feature of Caesar’s Commentarii found in this passage is

choices.label: an address by Caesar to his soldiers before a battle

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
